title: The misunderstanding brewing between Macron and Barnier
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron had preferred Michel Barnier to other contenders for the role of prime minister, with the assurance that he would not question his economic policy.

title: 'Family destroyed': Children of French rape victim speak of heartbreak
summary: The daughter and sons of Dominique and Gisèle Pelicot spoke in court in the southern city of Avignon as the trial entered its final stages

title: Kremlin accuses Biden of 'fueling the fire' in Ukraine ahead of Trump's return to the White House
summary: On Monday, the Kremlin vowed a 'response' if Ukraine fires US missiles into Russia. A US official told Agence France-Presse (AFP) on Sunday that Biden had cleared Kyiv to use long-range American missiles against military targets inside Russia.

title: Biden seeks nearly $100 billion in emergency disaster aid after Hurricanes Helene and Milton
summary: With many Republicans campaigning on reducing federal spending, there could be some debate about portions of Biden's request, as the federal government doesn't help with every disaster. It generally gets involved only if the needs are above the ability of a community or state to handle.

title: In Sudan, Al-Naw hospital is on the front line of the civil war
summary: 'In Sudan, a total war' (6/8). Ravaged by conflict since April 2023, only 20% to 30% of the country's hospitals are operational. Al-Naw Hospital, on the outskirts of Khartoum, the remaining caregivers are doing their utmost to treat the countless civilian casualties.

title: Death of Charles Dumont, sentimental crooner and composer of songs for Edith Piaf and Dalida
summary: The career of the singer, author of numerous piano romances enhanced by violins, was launched by the song 'Non, Je ne Regrette Rien,' written for 'La Môme.'

title: French farmers demonstrate against EU-Mercosur free trade agreement
summary: President Emmanuel Macron and Prime Minister Michel Barnier spoke out against the trade treaty with South American countries. But they failed to calm the anger of farmers.

title: 'Dune: Prophecy': The exercise of power in a galactic convent
summary: Set 100 centuries before the events recounted in Denis Villeneuve's films, this mystical and political series finds its way between respect for the text and originality.

title: Biden authorizes Ukraine to use long-range missiles to strike deep into Russian territory
summary: Washington has finally ceded to a request Kyiv has been making for months: authorization to use ATACMS missiles, which can reach a target almost 300 kilometers away.

title: Ukraine on the defensive, both militarily and diplomatically
summary: Under heavy Russian bombardment, Ukraine is worried about having to negotiate from a position of weakness. Kyiv's request to use long-range ATACMS missiles to aim at military targets deep inside Russian territory was approved by Joe Biden.

title: Condom use is declining among young people
summary: Under-30s are most at risk of transmitting sexually transmitted infections. And yet, according to the latest survey by Inserm and ANRS, condom use during the first intercourse fell between 2019 and 2023.

title: Charles Dumont, composer of Edith Piaf's 'Non, je ne regrette rien,' dies at 95
summary: A trumpeter by training, Dumont's career transformed when he convinced Edith Piaf to perform one of his compositions, after she had turned him down several times.

title: French far right steps ups threats of bringing down government
summary: A close ally of Marine Le Pen called for a motion of no confidence in case the government uses a constitutional tool to pass the budget without a vote.

title: Paris journalism school taken over by billionaire media owners
summary: Bernard Arnault, Vincent Bolloré and Rodolphe Saadé are among the tycoons who have bought out the Ecole Supérieure de Journalisme in Paris.

title: In Argentina, Macron pays tribute to dictatorship's victims, sending message to Milei
summary: Victims' families are concerned about the dismantling of remembrance policies by the far-right president's government.

title: In Argentina, the difficult dialogue between Macron and Milei
summary: Javier Milei, the first foreign leader to meet Donald Trump since his election, hosted Emmanuel Macron on Sunday, as Paris and Buenos Aires clash on major issues, from the fight against global warming to the EU-Mercosur free-trade treaty.

title: Strike at SNCF: railway workers fight against the "balkanization" of the company
summary: The railway unions are calling for a strike on Thursday and are planning a further strike in December. They are denouncing the break-up of the company into private subsidiaries and preparing for wage negotiations, but are finding it difficult to mobilize.

title: 'Talking drum' to return to Côte d'Ivoire as French government drags on restitution law
summary: The Ayôkwé Djidji will be exposed in its home country, but France has yet to pass legislation allowing for it to be formally restituted.

title: 'Trump's election could be a wake-up call for Europe, or accelerate its decline'
summary: The EU needs to come up with a response to the threat posed to the global economy by US protectionism and demonstrate that it is capable of turning this risk into an opportunity, argues Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.
